required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving HF Treatment and GDMT in IHS
clinical_study.official_title: Improving the Quality of Heart Failure Care Among American Indian Patients in the Indian Health Service: A Pragmatic Clinic Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Heart failure causes significant morbidity and mortality, particularly in Navajo Nation. There are well-established evidence of improved mortality and lower heart failure hospitalizations with certain pharmacotherapies for heart failure with reduced ejection fraction (HFrEF). However, these medications are underutilized nationally, including in the Indian Health Service which is one important driver of poor heart failure outcomes. Therefore, as part of an EHR-based pragmatic clinic trial, we are implementing and testing a model that identifies American Indian HFrEF patients receiving care at one large Indian Health Service Site who meet clinical criteria for, but are not on appropriate therapy, and implement a model in which our study team will get patients on appropriate therapy while also supporting primary care providers with cardiology telementorship. We will evaluate the impact of this model to improve uptake of GDMT among HFrEF patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage that had Increase in Classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy
primary_outcome.description: % of Patients that had Increase in the number of classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy (Beta-blocker, ACEi/Angiotensin receptor blockers, Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor, Aldosterone receptor antagonists, SGLT2i)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage that had Increase in Classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: % of Patients that had Increase in the number of classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy (Beta-blocker, Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors/Angiotensin receptor blockers, Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor, Aldosterone receptor antagonists, Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitors)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage that had Increase in Classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: % of Patients that had Increase in the number of classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy (Beta-blocker, Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors/Angiotensin receptor blockers, Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor, Aldosterone receptor antagonists, Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitors)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage that had Increase in Classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy
secondary_outcome.description: % of Patients that had Increase in the number of classes of Guideline Directed Medical Therapy (B-blocker, Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors/Angiotensin receptor blockers, Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor, Aldosterone receptor antagonists, Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitors)
Rates of Rx for Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitors
Rates of Rx for Aldosterone receptor antagonists
Rates of Rx for Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors
Rates of Rx for Angiotensin receptor blockers

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose change of Angiotensin receptor blockers
secondary_outcome.description: Dose change of Rx for Angiotensin receptor blockers

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose change of Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor
secondary_outcome.description: Dose change of Rx for Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitor

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose change of Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors
secondary_outcome.description: Dose change of Rx for Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors
Dose change of Rx for Beta-blocker

secondary_outcome.measure: Dose change of Aldosterone receptor antagonists
secondary_outcome.description: Dose change of Rx for Aldosterone receptor antagonists

other_outcome.description: Through a provider survey, we will assess how satisfied (1-10) patients and (separately) providers are with the implementation of this model.

other_outcome.measure: Provider Comfort with Guideline Directed Medical Therapy prescribing
other_outcome.description: Baseline and follow up comfort prescribing therapy: Through survey we will assess at baseline and on follow-up how comfortable (from 1-10) providers feel with prescribing each of the following medications: Beta-blocker, Aldosterone receptor antagonist, Angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitors, Angiotensin Receptor-Neprilysin Inhibitors, Sodium-glucose co-transporter 2 inhibitors.

arm_group.description: Patient enrolled in the GDMT EHR-based HF improvement program

intervention.description: Patients will be prescribed appropriate GDMT for HFrEF if they meet clinical criteria by the study team, appropriate lab work and follow up testing will be sent and followed up by the team. All recommendations and plans will be copied to primary care providers who can opt out if disagree, but also to improve telementoring to build clinical comfort.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with heart failure with reduced ejection fraction with last ejection fraction equal to or less than 40%
- Have a primary care physician at Gallup Indian Medical Center or Tohatchi Health Center
- Have been seen in the last 12 months at Gallup Indian Medical Center or Tohatchi Health Center
Exclusion Criteria:
- On hospice
- LVAD/translant
- Home inotropes
- No visit in last 12 months at Gallup Indian Medical Center or Tohatchi Health Center

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient data is protected by the Navajo Nation Human Research Board
